conversationHistory.content:
Heart disease refers to a range of conditions that affect the heart, including coronary artery disease, heart rhythm problems (arrhythmias), and heart defects. Common risk factors include high blood pressure, high cholesterol, smoking, obesity, physical inactivity, and diabetes.

Symptoms can vary widely but may include chest pain, shortness of breath, fatigue, and irregular heartbeats. 

Management often involves lifestyle changes like a heart-healthy diet, regular exercise, quitting smoking, managing stress, and medications to control risk factors.

If you have specific questions about heart disease or its management in a clinical setting, feel free to ask!
